greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = sigma(n^5).
comment: a(n) modulo 6 begins: [1,3,4,1,0,0,0,3,1,0,0,4,0,0,0,1,0,3,0,0,0,0,0,0,1,0,...], in which positions of nonzero residues seem related to squares.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Multiplicative with a(p^e) = (p^(5*e+1)-1)/(p-1) for prime p. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Jul 23 2018
example: where the g.f. of A203557 begins:
mathematica: f[p_, e_] := (p^(5*e + 1) - 1)/(p - 1); a[1] = 1; a[n_] := Times @@ f @@@ FactorInteger[n]; Array[a, 50] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Sep 09 2020 *)
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Jan 03 2012
